Key Arguments: The legislation is based on a flawed premise of objective truth, which contradicts the subjective truth favored by current left-leaning governments.
Censorship legislation lacks credibility due to the government's contradictory truth systems.
Science and truth are subject to change and debate, which censorship undermines.
Censorship of values, such as marriage definitions, is a form of social control and anti-democratic.
Governments themselves have been guilty of spreading misinformation, making them unsuitable to regulate it.
Notable Quotes: There is a glaring hypocrisy in a government holding two irreconcilable systems of truth together.
Any government that wishes to censor on the basis of a fixed and unchanging science has to explain why centuries of philosophy has warned of its achilles heel.
The Federal Governmentâ€™s ACMA legislation operates on the assumption that governments can ably divine the truth in any field of inquiry.
